attributes.action: Free Sanitary products for women and girls on benefits
attributes.background: Read a homeless lady on Tube crying and asking fellow passengers if any had spare Tampons or Pads ; if chaps had to use them bet they would be FOC

attributes.action: Ban fake numbers being used for sales, marketing, PPI and personal injury calls.
attributes.background:
We frequently receive calls about that 'accident' we've had or about that PPI claim we could make.

Companies use a fake number, so that you have no way of tracing where the call from and so they are unaccountable.  

I propose that UK phone networks apply technology to block such calls.

attributes.action: provide free water for everyone on the street of UK in this extreme hot weather
attributes.background: I think water must be free in this hot weather for everyone specially homeless people living on the street. The government must provide funding to local councils to facilitate the supply of free water in the street on UK. The local government must help local shops to provide water to everyone.
attributes.additional_details: The condition is extremely hot and people can get dehydrated and homeless people are at higher risk. Water must be provided by the local government in form of a water fountain or local shops providing them by local council finding them. This is a government’s duty to keep their people safe.

attributes.action: Stop the ban of menthol cigarettes when the UK leaves the EU
attributes.background: A cigarette is a cigarette menthol or not, it's just a preference as is coke with vodka. In 2020 menthol cigarettes were to be banned under new EU laws but the UK is preparing to leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst on the topic binge drinking seems to be a regular thing and alcohol also takes/ruins many lives but I don't see any graphic images or warnings on alcohol. End the menthol and flavoured tobacco ban in 2020 since the UK is leaving the EU.

attributes.action: Tax financial institutions to pay for social care, instead of personal taxation.
attributes.background:
Banks caused the global financial meltdown and took billions in bailouts from taxpayers. I think they’d should pay this back via a social care levy.
It would also help to restore public confidence in the banks.

attributes.action: Hold a general election within the next 2 years
attributes.background: We are in the middle of the Brexit process and the government has made no progress at all so far, when we’re about to leave the EU in March next year.  This literally shows that this government is too weak to govern the country and to come to an agreement on terms.
attributes.additional_details: Also, some council elections will be in May 2022, which means the General Election will clash with the council elections and we’re supposed to have one election within this five year timeframe, not more than one.

attributes.action: Lower the age of consent to 14 or 15
attributes.background: I believe that people hit puberty at about 12. At 14-15, people are still going through puberty but I believe that they are also mature enough to give consent.
attributes.additional_details: Underage sex/pregnancy is a big issue. Moving the age of consent down, while still keeping it at an age where people are old enough to give consent, would reduce underage sex.

attributes.action: Introduce a regulatory body for the recruitment industry
attributes.background: A regulatory body should be introduced to ensure recruiters play fair with all parties.

attributes.action: Review racially discriminatory Gang Matrix(ces) obedience to human rights laws.
attributes.background: The Gang Matrix launched by Trident Gang Command is a system that has been found to disproportionately target BAME young men in their relation, or lack thereof, to gang crime. Information is often shared with other authorities limiting their access to opportunities and their chances of success.
attributes.additional_details:
The Metropolitan Police Service Gangs Violence Matrix and other similar Matrices should be dismantled, unless police services can demonstrate that they have been brought in line with international human rights law, in particular, the right to non-discrimination, privacy and family life, as contained in international human rights law. 
For further details read the recommendations highlighted in Amnesty International report: https://www.amnesty.org.uk/files/reports/Trapped%20in%20the%20Matrix%20Amnesty%20report.pdf

attributes.action: Transition the United Kingdom into a federation of constitutional republics
attributes.background: Abolish the monarchy and reform the United kingdom into a federation of constitutional republics

attributes.action: Have a second EU referendum and allow 15 to 17 year olds to vote as well
attributes.background: As a 16 year old and hearing all the stuff in the news it frustrates me. As my age is the next generation and we should have a say on what we want our future to look like. It’s not fair for people who’ll be long gone to vote the future of the next generation. Us teenagers 15+ should have our say.

attributes.action: Reinstate the Senior care worker on the job shortage list (Tier 2 visa General)
attributes.background: All care sectors across the UK, have benefited from staffing through Senior care workers being on job shortage list (Tier 2 General). Since the removal of this profession from the list it has been increasingly difficult for employers to find staff to work  senior care job roles.
attributes.additional_details: Care settings such as NHS, private residential homecare, nursing homes and domiciliary care have all benefited for this profession being on the job shortage list.

attributes.action: Force Rail Ticketing to allow for WFH and Auto Delay/Cancellation Repayments
attributes.background:
Our Rail ticketing is clearly out of date and the rail companies are failing 
1) Automatic Repayments should be mandatory for Delays and Cancellations 
2)With occasional Working From Home, tickets should be for a number of days usage not a calendar month or year
attributes.additional_details: The last few year rail travel has been appalling, Southern started a scheme to automatically refund for delays, South Western Railway have stopped this without filling in forms needing completion. They have our details linked to the ticket, this should be an automatic process. Our ticketing is out of date and the rail companies are frankly failing.

attributes.action: 65% majority referendum to approve the offer to leave EU or else stay in the EU
attributes.background:
Lisbon Treaty Art 50 in effect needs 65% of remaining population to approve a state leaving. Therefore 65% of population leaving should approve
UK Companies Act 2006: 75% vote to change rules that govern its conduct with members. We are considering the relationship between the UK and its citizens
attributes.additional_details:
2016 Referendum result: Leave 17,410,742 – 51.89%; Remain 16,141,241- 48.11% – just 3.78% in favour.  This has been, and continues to be, a most divisive and disproportionate margin for the well being of the UK and its citizens

When the 2016 referendum was taken the campaign was generalised slogans and proclamations and could not clearly set out specific consequences and realities: which were at the time impossible to know. Now we know them

To end division and animosity we need clear majority

attributes.action: Require dining establishments (restaurants, bars, pubs) to offer metal straws.
attributes.background: In response to the problem of an ever-increasing amount of plastic waste polluting our environment, we need to make restaurants, bars, pubs and any similar establishments offer metal straws as a substitution for plastic straws. This will benefit our planet, dining establishments and customers alike.
attributes.additional_details: Metal straws are a better alternative to paper straws as they are reusable. Similar to dishware including mugs and glasses, metal straws can be washed and reused. Therefore, the use of metal straws will produce no waste. The reusable nature of metal straws also provide financial benefits for the establishments as it is a one-time purchase. Furthermore, it addresses the 'soggy' issue of paper straws providing a practical alternative that all people can use.

attributes.action: Legalise assisted dying for terminal illnesses.
attributes.background: It's wrong that doctors have to keep alive people who are in either serious physical or mental distress when they wish to end their own lives.
attributes.additional_details: Anyone should be able to do whatever they want with their own lives. We're all supposed to live in a country where we supposedly have pure freedom. People can't end their lives if their life is a horror every day.

attributes.action: Stop firework work displays  on armistice Sunday
attributes.background: Today  on the 11/11/2018 silence fell at 11am to mark 100 years  of the first world war and  silence was across  the globe. No fireworks on this day

attributes.action: Minimum speed limit for motorways.
attributes.background: Make the minimum speed limit for cars on motorways to match the maximum speed for trucks. Cars travelling slower than trucks cause dangerous situations where the truck has to overtake or be forced to slow down. This is especially dangerous on two lane sections and in bad weather.

attributes.action: Large donations to political parties validated by the Electoral Commission
attributes.background:
At present each political party validates large donations to their party. The Electoral Commission should validate and either approve or reject the donation . After validation the funds would be transferred to the party.
Make all donations and rejected donations public. Apply one set of rules.

attributes.action: Lower the age at which men can claim the state pension.
attributes.background: In an age of total equality, surely it is only fair and right that men and women enjoy a similar amount of time in retirement. As life expectancy for men is, on average, 4 years shorter than for women, surely they (men) should be able to claim their state pension 4 years earlier.

attributes.action: Stop UK Government foreign aid to India
attributes.background: UK’s global aid commitment is in the countries national interest, but when £330 million is squandered on a giant bronze statue in India it must be seriously evaluated whether that money could not better be spent at home.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of Hair dye to the public.
attributes.background: According to the BBC 33% of the public that dye there hair at home have some form of reaction, Many of this 33% have had a terrible reaction leading them into hospital and seeking expert advice. The public some into salons for hair colourist to fix there problem which can be a very long process.
attributes.additional_details: I push that the sale of hair dye should be prohibited, This will decrease the % of people having a reaction to hair dye. Hairdressers always preform a patch test to check if someone is allergic to the main chemical ingredients of hair dye. I ask that hair dye is strictly available for professionals only who hold the relevant qualification.

attributes.action: Abolish faith schools
attributes.background: Children under no circumstance should be submitted to education in religious schools. We should encourage future generations to have an academic mindset free from religious belief.
attributes.additional_details: Religion is a choice that should be made in adulthood and not influenced and preached onto young growing minds.

attributes.action: Enforce companies to label products and packaging with decomposition dates.
attributes.background: I am just an ordinary person who wants to help save our planet from drowning in plastic. If every item and its packaging were labelled with a date showing how much time they would take to decompose, then companies would be forced to re-evaluate their products and packaging.
attributes.additional_details: Labelling goods and packaging with decomposition dates would also increase awareness in society and people would make informed environmental choices when buying items. There is plastic everywhere. Take a walk around your local supermarket, or any other shop and observe the masses of plastic that is literally everywhere. Some normal plastic items can take up to 1000 years to decompose. A plastic bottle can take up to 450 years or more. If the government agreed to decomposition date labels on all goods and packaging, it would be a step in the right direction.

attributes.action: Ban religious studies in schools
attributes.background: Religion does not belong in the school system. I do not send my child to school to learn about religion - that is what church is for.

attributes.action: Lower the tax for fuel so it’s more affordable
attributes.background: The fuel prices in the uk are reaching an all time high, other country’s pay way less on fuel! This needs to be actioned now !

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory 42 year prison sentences for using a knife against another.
attributes.background: The knife crime epidemic in the UK is out of control.  There is at present no suitable deterrent and with the increasing lawlessness and lack of visible policing, evildoers are increasingly prepared to threaten and use a knife against a fellow citizen.  Knife injuries for victims are life sentences.
attributes.additional_details:
https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN04304

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/uk-knife-crime-police-gang-violence-stabbings-record-figures-a8589626.html

https://www.statista.com/statistics/864736/knife-crime-in-london/

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/crimeandjustice/bulletins/crimeinenglandandwales/yearendingmarch2018

attributes.action: All consumables, must by law have a biodegradable time scale stated them.
attributes.background: If for example "Bio 1mo" or "Bio 600yr" had to be printed or stamped on consumables by law.  Making consumers see how long their item will take to biodegrade may make ppl think twice. Biodegradable is a misinterpreted word, by stating actual time scales consumers can make an informed decision.
attributes.additional_details: We are killing our planet, slowly suffocating it. People still do not like to be told what to do, by putting the ball back in their hands, letting them make the choice by actually seeing what effect their lifestyle has in real time may make ppl think more and make better chioces.

attributes.action: Public inquiry into Barnsley Local Authority Social Services
attributes.background: A Judge seriously criticised Barnsley Local Authority Social Services  for their heavy-handed tactics whilst conducting safeguarding investigations into a vulnerable child who talked about “wanting to kill herself to be with her mum” who had committed suicide.
attributes.additional_details: The actions of Barnsley Social Services have also been criticised by others and should be subject to a public inquiry.

attributes.action: Remove “positive action for recruitment and promotion” from the Equality Act
attributes.background: Under the Equality Act, an employer can use "positive action" to promote or recruit a candidate from a certain group with a protected characteristic deemed to be under-represented in the work force if they are considered "as qualified as" another candidate who isn't from that group.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that this is not positive but unethical and discriminatory. A law supposed to prevent discrimination encourages it, particularly when it comes to employment. Nobody should be at an advantage and nobody should be at a disadvantage due to their ethnicity or any other factor they have no control over. I want the positive action exemption for recruitment and promotion to be removed from the Equality Act.

attributes.action: Jeremy Hunt to make full apology for comparing the EU and Soviet Union
attributes.background: The foreign secretary, Jeremy Hunt, has been rebuked by the European Commission for a speech at the Conservative party conference where he seemed to compare the European Union to the Soviet Union. Such remarks are damaging to Britain as a nation and particularly so coming from the Foreign Secretary.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2018/oct/01/jeremy-hunt-draws-eu-ire-over-soviet-prison-comparison

attributes.action: Hold a referendum for devolution in the North of England.
attributes.background: In 2004 the North East of England had a devolution referendum. Due to the small turnout the same referendum for the North West of England was never held. It is the opinion of many that the socio-economic divide between the North and the South of England has grown exponentially over the past decade.
attributes.additional_details: With growing cases of the North not having their issues and needs fairly addressed in the Southern biased Parliament, it is time that a referendum is held to offer those citizens North of the River Trent an opportunity to vote on devolution. This will provide a platform for issues relevant to the North of England to be considered without an underlying London-centricity.

attributes.action: Make GBL a higher class than cannabis, currently only a class C
attributes.background: A lot of people have died from the date rape drug GBL yet it’s only a class C and available to buy got cleaning purposes off the internet.
attributes.additional_details: Please help me get backing for this share it as much as you like. I’ve lost too many people to the drug and don’t see how it’s a lower class than cannabis.

attributes.action: Appeal for the UN to ban Lethal Autonomous Weapons
attributes.background: Countries across the world are on the verge to finish artificially intelligent weapons by 2019. These machines will result in unfathomable consequences that humans cannot foresee. International legislation must be pressured by the UK to keep up to date before the technology is finished and utilised.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lethal_autonomous_weapon

https://autonomousweapons.org

https://futureoflife.org/2018/04/30/lethal-autonomous-weapons-an-update-from-the-united-nations/?cn-reloaded=1

https://www.janes.com/article/79311/china-s-shock-call-for-ban-on-lethal-autonomous-weapon-systems

attributes.action: Lower the percentage for child maintenance deductions from earnings
attributes.background: The current cms payment scheme for non resident parents has a massive impact on non resident working people that are paying rent and bills for their current living situation. A drop in pay or overtime no less than 25 % will leave you with nothing to pay rent and bills.
attributes.additional_details: Non resident fathers will be left in financial difficulty with the cms payment scheme and would be forced to leave work this is not good for the kids that need money.

attributes.action: More training for teachers in supporting and identifying childhood trauma
attributes.background: The number of children experiencing abuse is much higher than acknowledged and is a serious issue in society, leading to addiction, crime and costing the NHS a huge amount. We can target the root of the problem and give teachers, people who see children day in day out, the skills to support and help

attributes.action: Ban smoking in apartments/flats
attributes.background: Smoking ban should be extended to apartments/flats, where there is a high and sustained risk of secondary inhalation. And where smokers reduce the health and life quality of neighbours.
attributes.additional_details: Ministry of Health is aware but choosing not to extend a ban to apartments for reasons unknown. However, as more and more of us are forced to live in apartments, a radical health policy rethink is required, and tougher legislation introduced.

attributes.action: Make teaching sexual abuse/assualt in more detail part of the curriculum
attributes.background: Many people (adults and children alike) who have been abused often say that they didn't realise what was happening was actually abuse for a very long time.  By educating children about what is abuse will empower them to protect themselves.  Abusers rely ignorance and secrecy.
attributes.additional_details: By talking about abuse of any kind openly and freely we take away the secrecy and make it less of a taboo subject and people may, hopefully, 1. be more aware of how to protect themselves, 2. feel more able to speak up if something does happen to them, 3. make abusers more wary of abusing.

attributes.action: Support Chez Save A Life Methanol Awareness campaign.
attributes.background: After Cheznye passed away in Thailand in 2013, our family started a campaign to make other tourists aware of the risks of Methanol Poisoning when abroad. After countless discussions with the governmental figures they decided that Methanol Poisoning awareness was not a priority for them.
attributes.additional_details: As a family we have still tried to push Methanol Awareness but alone, our message doesn't spread far enough. 17 more tourists have suffered Methanol Posioning in Zante recently and I don't suspect this will be the last cases unless we create some awareness for tourists. We need support to from our government to raise awareness and save lives.

attributes.action: Install a fence or screen in the middle of motorways to prevent rubber necking
attributes.background: Rubber necking creates massive amounts of traffic even on a road that is totally unaffected. For example, an accident on the opposite carriage can cause a queue or a crash due to people looking across the road instead of where they're going. We need to install screens or barriers to prevent this!

attributes.action: Reduce the eligibility of Police long service medal from 20 to 15 years
attributes.background:
Emergency services especially in current times face dangers day in and day out. But have to wait 5 years longer for any formal recognition.
It is proposed that the long service medal of both the police and fire service should be reduced from 20 years to 15 years exactly like the armed forces.

attributes.action: Scrap the MOT test.
attributes.background: The MOT test is outdated and does not save lives but only costs motorists money.

attributes.action: Require CCJs to be sent by recorded post
attributes.background: CCJs are just sent by normal post. If these are not received or sent to a previous address they are just entered against you. This is completely unfair which if you find out you have one, you then have to pay to get it set aside as you had no chance of defence. This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: These need to at least be sent by recorded post and not entered if they are not received.

attributes.action: Give the Firemen, the Police, The Emergency Services a National Day.
attributes.background: Recently, I celebrated my daughter's 4 year old birthday. I invited the local Fire crew, then local Police. I was absolutely overwhelmed with their kindness in turning up and taking the time in talking to the little ones, their patience, their absolute dedication to their job.
attributes.additional_details: They all have been through so much lately, and I got to realise, why do we celebrate the army, who rightly protect us (My little girl's father is ex military, bomb disposal), but not these people, who risk their life for us on a daily basis. They deserve our support. So very much. Please do help me giving them the chance to parade, be proud, be cheered, be supported.

attributes.action: All foods that contain gelatine must state what type of animal it is made from
attributes.background: I would like this to happen as many religions have certain foods that they are not allowed to eat.
attributes.additional_details:
Reading the ingredients on the back of food to check and it just says gelatine is not helpful. This petition is simple and wants companies to be required to specify what animal gelatine is in their products.

I really hope we can do this as a United Kingdom and bring together at least 10,000 signatures so we can get a written response from the Government!

attributes.action: Prevent those in Public Service from withholding data
attributes.background: Data laws are being used to cover up & block complaints. Organisations and public bodies should have to prove in court that a request is vexatious before they can refuse to give information. The ICO should be given the funds and powers to fully investigate non-compliance with the law.
attributes.additional_details: Those who don't fully comply with a request in 1 calendar month must be fined. The impact on those who suffer failure, abuse and hostility is worse if they can't access all their records to pursue a complaint. It affects the most vulnerable, those on low incomes who may not be able to access public services e.g. housing, disabled facilities, innocent children forced out of school, school bullying covered up that may lead to children self-harming or children/individuals targeted by authorities.

attributes.action: Allow the disabled access to biodegradable single use plastics in any future ban
attributes.background: There has been a considerable number of concerns raised by the disabled community and allies about the need for single use plastics in their lives. I would like the language of any ban on any single use plastics to include an exemption for biodegradable plastics for the disabled community.

attributes.action: Re-introduce free milk in primary and secondary schools
attributes.background: Free milk was a great way of making children that little bit happier about going to school, so now I believe we should reintroduce it back to schools

attributes.action: have Tinnitus retraining therapy in all UK hospitals
attributes.background: about 1 in every 5 people in the UK suffer from Tinnitus and having Tinnitus retrainning therapy in a hospital closer to their house will help them.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to feed and encourage seagulls to nest
attributes.background: The spiralling number of seagulls in our cities and surrounding suburbs are adversely impacting the mental well-being of residents. Their incessant screeching starts in earnest in the early hours and persists for much of the day. They defecate on property, vehicles and washing and attract vermin
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/weird-news/residents-declare-war-seagulls-poisoned-6098194
http://www.worcesternews.co.uk/news/13581245.New_crackdown_drawn_up_to_tackle__aggressive__seagulls_in_Worcester/
https://www.economist.com/britain/2017/02/09/britains-war-on-seagulls
https://www.fixmystreet.com/report/26682
https://www.theedinburghreporter.co.uk/2017/02/morningside-councillor-wants-council-to-get-rid-of-gulls/
